alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 5:46PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated bands of thunderstorms with torrential rainfall moving across northern portions of Dorchester and Berkeley Counties. These thunderstorms will continue to expand through early this evening, increasing the risk for minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. Several observation sites in northern Dorchester County have reported as much as 2 inches of rain in less than 30 minutes. Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas is likely occurring. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moncks Corner, Saint George, Dorchester, Saint Stephen, Harleyville, Bonneau, Reevesville, Jamestown, Cross, Pinopolis, Eadytown, Bonneau Beach, Old Santee Canal State Park, Chicora, Moorefield, Cross Cross Roads and Murraysville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
